body:
So I recently spilled some DP on my keyboard and I was wondering what you all think the best solution would be. I took off all of the keys on my keyboard and put them in hot water and just soaking. 

Any other suggestions?
body_tagged:
So I recently spilled some DP on my keyboard and I was wondering what you all think the best solution would be. I took off all of the keys on my keyboard and put them in hot water and just soaking. 

Any other suggestions?
title: Laptop help

replies.body:
Did you even try to see if it works? lmao
If it does, then.. What's the problem?
replies.body_tagged:
Did you even try to see if it works? lmao
If it does, then.. What's the problem?

replies.body: Wipe with a damp cloth after taking off all the keys.
replies.body_tagged: Wipe with a damp cloth after taking off all the keys.

replies.body:
If the keys are sticky wipe the keys off with a damp cloth.
I recommend also wiping the rubber cap off the keys (careful, they break off pretty easily from experience xd)
replies.body_tagged:
If the keys are sticky wipe the keys off with a damp cloth.
I recommend also wiping the rubber cap off the keys (careful, they break off pretty easily from experience xd)

replies.body: Remember kids, if you want enable sticky keys, this isn't the way to do it.
replies.body_tagged: Remember kids, if you want enable sticky keys, this isn't the way to do it.

replies.body: The good thing about Lenovo laptops is that they have a draining feature underneath the keys so they are easy to clean. once I spilled some Coke on my keyboard, and then all I had to do was pour soapy water on my keyboard to get rid of the stickyness over a sink.
replies.body_tagged: The good thing about Lenovo laptops is that they have a draining feature underneath the keys so they are easy to clean. once I spilled some Coke on my keyboard, and then all I had to do was pour soapy water on my keyboard to get rid of the stickyness over a sink.
